newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee stable vs dollar, firms vs stg.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee stable vs dollar, firms vs stg.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee was stable against the dollar and slightly stronger against sterling on Tuesday, reflecting quiet international market trends, foreign exchange dealers said.
The rupee was quoted at a commercial mean rate of 20.6045 to the dollar, unchanged from Monday. It was fixed at a commercial mean rate of 33.404 to sterling, from 33.4235 on Monday.
Dealers said international markets were quiet, with no big activity noted.
They said the local market remained slightly short of hard currency and some commercial banks needed to meet demands from importers.
